The Boulder Zoo's animals are in danger. The owner of the Zoo has decided to sell out and make money off the exotic animals in captivity. The zoo owner is going to sell the animals to Zoo'd Food, a company that turns exotic animals into delicacies for the rich and powerful.

Twelve hours before the truck is to arrive and transport the animals to certain death, Poncho the Flamingo overhears two guards discussing the fate of the animals. Poncho knows it is up to him to formulate a plan to get all of the animals to freedom. He must free the animals one by one, using each animal's unique skills to help free the other animals.
